newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy prepares to send aid to Albania - ministry.
newsitem.headline: Italy prepares to send aid to Albania - ministry.

text.p: Italy said on Friday it was preparing to send emergency health supplies to Albania at the request of its Prime Minister Bashkim Fino.

The foreign ministry said in a statement that the supplies, in the form of health kits, would be enough for 300,000 people for a month. A spokesman said Italy, acting unilaterally, would fly the aid to Tirana on Saturday or Sunday.

The statement said Italy was sending "a first emergency humanitarian intervention for the Albanian people" following Fino's request. The supplies will be flown to Tirana by military aircraft or helicopter and delivered to the health ministry.

News agency ANSA reported earlier that Italy was moving 800 troops, including members of crack paratroop regiments, to the southeast port of Brindisi in case they were required for deployment in a European Union relief mission in Albania.

EU foreign ministers meet on Monday in Brussels to consider whether to send a defence force to assist a humanitarian relief mission after violent unrest this month sparked by the collapse of savings schemes in Europe's poorest country.
The EU has said it was prepared to send aid "in two or three days" but stressed that military security must be ensured first.
